subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In mainland China ({{w|Traditional Chinese|traditional form}} based on {{w|Xin Zixing}}, {{w2|zh|新字形}}), the right component is <font size=4>{{l|mul|兹}}</font> (contains <big>{{l|mul|䒑}}</big>).
* In Taiwan (based on its {{w|zh:國字標準字體|standard form}} of national characters) and Hong Kong (based on the {{w|Hong Kong Supplementary Character Set}}), the right component is <font size=5, lang=zh-hant>[[茲#Translingual|茲]]</font> (contains <font size=4, lang=zh-hant>[[艹#Translingual|艹]]</font>, grass radical with 4 strokes).
* In Japanese {{w|kanji}}, the right component is <font size=5, lang=ja>[[茲#Translingual|茲]]</font> (same as Taiwan/Hong Kong) but the grass radical <font size=4, lang=ja>[[艹#Translingual|艹]]</font> is written with 3 strokes instead.
* Due to {{w|Han unification}}, all the forms above are encoded under the same [[code point]]. This character will appear differently depending on the font used.
* In the historical {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}, the upper component of <font size=5, lang=zh-hant>[[茲#Translingual|茲]]</font> is written with <font size=4>[[⻀]]</font> (ram's horn component) instead of the grass radical.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=195|rad=魚|as=10|asmj=09|sn=21|snmj=20|four=28332|canj=NFTVI|ids=⿰魚兹(G),⿰魚茲(HTJ)}} <!-- Note: Unicode charts show ⿰魚兹 for Hong Kong which is an older form. Latest form used in Hong Kong based on HKSCS 2016 (Page 48) is ⿰魚茲 with grass radical -->

subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text: * <big>{{l|mul|[[𫚤]]}}</big> ''(Extended {{w|Simplified Chinese characters|simplified form}} in mainland China)''
